intro: Eubotryoides, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the wet tropical forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, elongated, and often translucent leaves. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees without deriving nutrients from them. Its flowers are small, white, and fragrant, often appearing in clusters. Due to its habitat specificity and vulnerability to environmental changes, Eubotryoides is considered a conservation concern.
